quest.name: Ronitt to the Rescue
journal:
 Quest Sync
Ronitt looks pleased to see you.

Ronitt once more expresses his gratitude to you for helping him improve his less-than-impressive dwarven manners. Now, however, the ambitious blacksmith wishes to locate a fine drop of grog to properly fuel his inventive urges. Your mention of Wright ale piques his interest, and he bids you to accompany him to speak to the village's mayor.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

Ronitt's request for Wright's finest ale is met with disappointment as Sai-Lewq and Eueliss explain the poor condition of their fields. The dwarf claims, however, that he may be able to help, and you find yourself being dragged back to the village of Tomra.

It seems that one of Xemutt's old stories holds a hint for solving the problem of Wright's underfed soil─a mineral known as rock phosphate. Xemutt directs Ronitt towards the former trading town of Amity, where a sample of rock phosphate might still be found.

Your arrival in Amity causes a small stir, but Ronitt's fine manners help secure you a warm welcome. Before long, a resident has given you leave to search the old trading crates for a chunk of rock phosphate.
You prise open a weathered wooden box to reveal the yellow-hued object of your search. Deliver the mineral sample to Ronitt.

An excited Ronitt accepts the chunk of rock phosphate and explains his plans to construct a mineral-sensing automaton. While he is occupied with building his invention, he asks that you visit the mayor of Wright to arrange a rendezvous.
You pass on Ronitt's plans to Sai-Lewq and Eueliss. Though somewhat dubious, the pair agree to accompany you to Tomra and the scheduled meeting place.

You arrive with your guests from Wright just in time for Ronitt to provide a demonstration of his automaton's phosphate-finding capabilities. Much to the surprise of Sai-Lewq and Eueliss, the “Orehound Ogre” soon returns with a barrow full of the yellow rock. The trundling contraption─and the ensuing commotion─attracts the attention of Chief Xamott, who heaps praise upon his diligent Tholl kin. Sai-Lewq then proceeds to strike a deal with the eldermost elder: ownership of the rock phosphate in return for a future delivery of the finest Wright ale. It seems you and Ronitt have helped forge a new bond between the villages of Wright and Tomra, and both parties agree that your timely involvement has changed their fates for the better.
objectives: Deliver the chunk of rock phosphate to Ronitt.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Forename! I was hopin' you'd come back to see me!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Heh heh, lali-ho!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: After you left, I said a “lali-ho” to every soul I could find, and now the whole village has started talkin' to me!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: A couple of the lads are even helpin' me to invent some new automata. Aye, I'm well on my way to becomin' the most famous smitty in Tomra!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: But if I'm to be a truly legendary blacksmith, there's just one little thing I'm missin'...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: A good drop of grog!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: It ain't that Tomra's brews are bad, but if I could get my hands on an extra-fine fermented beverage, then I reckon my work would really take off!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: So! Any idea where I might find a barrel of the good stuff?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Wright ale...? And this drink once put their village on the map, eh? Well, then, I'd best take a trip down the cliff and have a chat with their leader!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: ...Y-You're comin' with me, ain't you!?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Well, look who it is!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Forename! How wonderful to see you again!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Since last you were here, I have been officially appointed as mayor of Wright. As such, my days have grown busy with visits to neighboring settlements to reacquaint myself with the region's politics. My old bones protest at the exercise, to say naught of the strain upon my rusty faculties...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Speaking of visits, I see you've arrived with a companion...?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: A-Aye! I'm Ronitt, of Tomra village! Don't think just because I'm smaller'n you that─! Er, I mean...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Lali-ho!!!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Lali...ho? Oh! I've heard of this! It's a traditional dwarven greeting, is it not?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I see. Well, let us not ignore the customs of our guest.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ahem. ...Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text:
Heh. Heh heh heh!
Not bad for first-timers! Not bad at all! Everyone's happy when their “lali-ho” gets a “lali-ho”!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Now, let's see a barrel of your tastiest grog!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I...beg your pardon!?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I follow...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ah... Well I'm afraid we're still struggling to improve the fertility of the land itself. As yet, we're unable to grow barley of sufficient quantity and quality to brew the ale for which we were once famous.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Aye, it's a matter of trial and error at this point. I am sorry to disappoint you...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Here now, what's with the sour faces!? You just need somethin' to liven up the soil, am I right!?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: You've some experience with cultivating fields, Master Ronitt?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Heh, not exactly...but I think I might be able to help all the same!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Come on, Forename! We need to make a quick trip back to Tomra!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Can he truly help us feed our fields? It sounds too good to be true...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I've no idea what Master Ronitt's plans might be, but with you involved, we can at least rest easy that naught bad will come of them.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Feels like everyone's starin' at me. Maybe this wasn't such a good idea...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: A dwarf visitor...? How unusual.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: About time you showed up! See, I remembered somethin' Xemutt told me once.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Xemutt! Can you tell me that story about Amity again? The bit about the trading goods?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: The villagers in Wright are havin' trouble growin' crops in their scratchy fields, and I wanted to do somethin' to help.

dialogue.name: XEMUTT
dialogue.text: Hmmm. You're thinking of the rock phosphate we used to trade to Eulmore?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Rock...phosphate? And that's the fertilizer, is it?

dialogue.name: XEMUTT
dialogue.text: Aye. Crushed into small bits, you can spread it over a field to enrich the soil. But the old seam was mined out years ago, and I've not heard if we've come across another...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect...you know, aside from there not bein' any left. No one kept a stockpile, then?

dialogue.name: XEMUTT
dialogue.text: Well, they might still have a chunk or two over in Amity. That was where the old trading house used to stand─neutral ground and all.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Right! To Amity I go! I-I suppose you'd best come along!

dialogue.name: XEMUTT
dialogue.text: That boy's come a long way in a short time, and I've a good idea why. Our Ronitt's lucky to have a friend like you.

dialogue.name: XEMUTT
dialogue.text: Visiting with young Ronitt again, are you?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: R-Right!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: La-La... Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: AMITYVILLAGER03560
dialogue.text: Well now, if it isn't one of the Tholls, come to visit. And a fine “lali-ho” to you, sir!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: I-I've come lookin' for rock phosphate! I just need a handful...assumin' you've got any!

dialogue.name: AMITYVILLAGER03560
dialogue.text: The yellowish fertilizer stuff? Hm, I reckon we had some stashed away someplace.

dialogue.name: AMITYVILLAGER03560
dialogue.text: Might be as you'll find a hunk of it hidin' in one of the old tradin' crates. Go ahead and take a handful, if that's all you want.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: I can just have it!? Th-That's very kind of you!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Phew! I'm glad you were here─still a bit nervous greetin' outsiders.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Anyway, let's get to crackin' open these crates. Keep an eye out for anythin' yellow and lumpy!

dialogue.name: AMITYVILLAGER03560
dialogue.text: Now that's a Tholl, if I'm not mistaken.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a small chunk of yellow-hued stone! It appears to match the description of rock phosphate.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If I was a hunk of rock phosphate, where would I be...?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Any luck on your end?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Aye, just look at that color─this has to be the stuff!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Now I've got a good-sized sample, I can build an automaton to sniff out a new seam of phosphate. This'll be one of my best inventions yet!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: While I'm throwin' that together, I need you to head back to Wright and tell those folk to meet me on the west side of Tomra. I'll make sure everythin's assembled and ready afore you arrive!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: ...A mineral fertilizer, you say? The name does sound vaguely familiar.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: We've experimented with all manner of compost over the years, but I'm willing to try anything to rejuvenate our fields! I wonder if another seam of this precious rock can still be found...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: We can but put our faith in Master Ronitt. Come, let us not be late for our meeting.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Even if naught comes of this, I want you to know we appreciate all you've done!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Oh good, I'd just finished testin' my new model!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Behold the mineral-findin' marvel that is the Orehound Ogre!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: S-Such a...colorful name. And this contraption is meant to sniff out phosphate for us, is it?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Heh heh, you just watch and see!

dialogue.name: AUTOMAN03560
dialogue.text: <bzzzt> <click> Sensors activated.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Is that...what I think it is!?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Astounding! You invented a servant to not only track down rock phosphate, but also carve it out and cart it back!? How did you accomplish such a feat?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Heh heh! You learn a thing or two when you aim to be the best damn blacksmith this village ever saw!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: I thought that trundlin' bucket of bolts would lead me to you, young Ronitt!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Th-The eldermost elder!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be Chief Xamott. I am Sai-Lewq, mayor of Wright. Master Ronitt here was just─

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: No need to explain─Xemutt already told me everythin'!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: It seems you've been workin' your beard thin for Wright's folk and their harvestin' woes, eh? A fine example of Tholl diligence, my boy!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Master Ronitt, we are truly grateful for the lengths to which you have gone to assist us in our hour of need...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: N-Now hold on a moment! I'm only doin' this so's I can get some fine ale to drink...

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Ale!? You're too young to drink, you snot-nosed stripling! What's wrong with admittin' you was just tryin' to help!?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Chief Xamott! You can't say it straight out like that! I'm buildin' an image here!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Hm hm...hahaha! Gahahaha!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: With your permission, Chief Xamott, we should like to take this rock phosphate back to our village.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: You have our promise that we shall put it to good purpose...and one day return the favor with our best barrel of Wright ale.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: That's a deal I can get behind! Aye, I think it's high time we Tholls reopened trade with our neighbors!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Heh heh! Just leave the delivery to me! But first I need to speak with my friends and build a few more Orehounds!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Did you hear that, sir? Instead of Talos, we shall soon have a line of automata rolling into the village!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Once more have you shown us the path forward. And that is not the only thing I must thank you for─I don't think I've enjoyed such a heartfelt laugh in many a moon!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I bless the day you came into our lives and changed our fate for the better. This kindness will not be forgotten!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: A-And I could say much the same! I'd still be alone with my automata if you hadn't come along when you did. All them folk who gave me wary frowns now greet me with a smile!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Well, I'd best be headed off! If I'm to be known as “Master Ronitt, the Greatest Blacksmith Who Ever Lived,” then I've still got plenty of work to do! I'll be seein' you, Forename!
